name: European Mobility Group
goal:
The European Mobility Group is a not-for-profit organisation of leading car adaptation and conversion companies across Europe. The EMGâ€™s principal objective is to encourage cooperation between companies involved in providing vehicles and related equipment for people with disabilities. EMG provides information about companies working to the same standards of quality and customer service, so that customers seeking specialists in this sector can be reassured that any company bearing the EMG logo can be trusted to deliver the highest standard of service and expertise.

Member companies share their knowledge of customer needs, and develop innovations and technical solutions together. Formed in 1987, EMG now has approximately 50 Member Companies across Europe and neighbouring countries, who collectively supply around 30,000 adapted and converted vehicles each year.
euInitiatives:
We aim to follow any legislation and standards relating to vehicles (M1) which are constructed, converted or adapted to meet the needs of disabled drivers and passengers.
We assume that the medium for such standards is mainly via the Motor Vehicles Working Group; but we are also tracking international standards bodies including ISO and CEN, as well as national standards and legislation.
We are also interested in any amendments to driving licensing for disabled drivers.
